video.title: Full Redux tutorial in 5 minutes
video.description:
Learn to build a to-do app using Redux in just 5 minutes.

Code here: https://codepen.io/VimGirl/pen/eGajxX

Video by Maricris Bonzo (aka Vim Girl). Check out her YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_FJLMQi9Xd4

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

replies.author: Song Zheng
replies.text: vim has a setting that displays $ at the end of the line to tell you where the end is. This way, if there are empty spaces at the end of the line you can see it right away.

topLevelComment.author: Harry Banda

topLevelComment.author: faruzzy
topLevelComment.text:
I do appreciate the effort but I have to say that the title is a little bit misleading.
If you watch this 5 min video and tell yourself at the end of it that you know Redux; the reality is that you DONT.
First of all, this video is at a higher speed.
That being said, concepts are just being thrown around without really explaining the "why". 
For example, since there's only a single reducer, she could have just used the `createStore` function, but instead, she jumps to the combineReducers functions
which is best used if you're trying to actually combine all your reducers into one.
Overall, if you really want to learn about redux, this video is just not enough!

replies.author: olamide333
replies.text:
I have to agree about the concepts being thrown around and not explaining the 'why'
not sure how everyone else who commented on how great it is, thinks that way.

topLevelComment.author: alexchiu
topLevelComment.text: Novice/mid-level javascript developer here... Ive never needed to used a library like redux to manage my application state before. It seems like another level of complexity . What benifits does it bring ? Should all apps large and small be using one ?

replies.author: dungeonwindow
replies.text: It all really does just seem like over complicating things to simplify another aspect that has been completely over complicated in the name of "convention".

replies.author: Rocky Kev
replies.text: You probably don't need to use redux if you're a small app - since it's overkill. But say if you build a react app with hundreds of components. React's philosophy is about passing props down to the children. So you have all these children 10 levels deep, and you constantly have to keep passing data down. OR, use redux.

replies.author: Gilliam Flebus
replies.text:
Most important benefit is the complete separation of your application state and view. This way you can easily time-travel (undo, redo) in your application and all your business logic (which states you can transition to from which states, state machine) is contained in the reducers. They're easy to test and the fact that your components are stateless also makes these easy to test.
It seems complex but if done well can save you a lot of debugging in the long run.

topLevelComment.author: Jamezrin
topLevelComment.text:
What are the pros of using redux in this scenario?

You can do this in less lines with vanilla js and we would not need a dependency and there would be no technical debt.

I'm really interested in modern webdev but honestly I can't really see the value as of now, please someone enlighten me.

By the way, great video but that line ending indicator is horrible

replies.author: Abhishek
replies.text: @faruzzy the video was for manly i think react learners to see use of react in vanilla js

replies.author: faruzzy
replies.text:
@freeCodeCamp.org Even if this was a production scenario redux would still be overkill. You generally need to start using Redux when you have complex states to manage all over your application. Usually, a piece of state would be accessible by different components on your page and would also be updated by those components.
I think the answer is in this example Redux was used to demonstrate its usage.

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: You would not normally use redux if this was a production scenario. The main point of this video is just to show how redux works.
